dt: {bc}of, relating to, or befitting a son or daughter
{bc}having or assuming the relation of a child or offspring

dt.t: The new village has a {wi}filial{/wi} relationship with the original settlement.

et: Middle English, from Late Latin {it}filialis{/it}, from Latin {it}filius{/it} son {ma}{mat|feminine|}{/ma}
shortdef: of, relating to, or befitting a son or daughter
having or assuming the relation of a child or offspring

dt: {bc}a generation in a breeding experiment that is successive to a mating between parents of two distinctively different but usually relatively pure genotypes

shortdef: a generation in a breeding experiment that is successive to a mating between parents of two distinctively different but usually relatively pure genotypes
